intro: Galium pseudorivale, commonly known as slender bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters. Its stems are often hairy and have a distinctive, aromatic scent. Galium pseudorivale is characterized by its ability to spread through rhizomes, forming dense mats in suitable habitats.
